dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (00:55): yum groupinstall "KDE (K Desktop Environment)"

26028c1f9b22a689752bf264e6a75afe (00:56): Irishman: usually you just need to trim the install down somewhat, my fedora installs have bever been more than the low end of the 3.x gb range (for a full time desktop)
26028c1f9b22a689752bf264e6a75afe (00:56): bever - never
45761c76b21ef734a800e31fdcbc5e44 (00:56): EvilGent and ?
2ba47b304ea2642eb488025d18f588c0 (00:56): AntonTakk: Including FC5?
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (00:56): Irishman: if you just want a small footprint of a distro, i would just check out damn small linux, an older version of FC really wont be a big diff
26028c1f9b22a689752bf264e6a75afe (00:56): Irishman: yeah
f0299588380580a528c8b3ff1527475d (00:56): pick one and paste to the pastebin malmen

dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (00:57): or instead of gnome/kde/xfce on fedora use fluxbox
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (00:57): and do a very very base install
45761c76b21ef734a800e31fdcbc5e44 (00:57): EvilGent

f0299588380580a528c8b3ff1527475d (00:57): Anvil,  the last thing he posted was using yum install kdebase and the mirrors crapped out
26028c1f9b22a689752bf264e6a75afe (00:57): Irishman: for example, install gnome or kde, not both, and leave out software you won't use, etc
2ba47b304ea2642eb488025d18f588c0 (00:57): AntonTakk: I think I can handle it being 3gb... will it auto detect a PCMCIA Linksys wireless?
2ba47b304ea2642eb488025d18f588c0 (00:58): AntonTakk: ya, I wont need gnome most likely.. dont use it much
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (00:58): MalMen: type this in your terminal
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (00:58): yum groupinstall "KDE (K Desktop Environment)"
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (00:58): hit <enter>
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (00:58): quotes and all
26028c1f9b22a689752bf264e6a75afe (00:58): Irishman: if it is supported, it should (FC5 install properly detects my netgear ma401ra pcmcia card)
f0299588380580a528c8b3ff1527475d (00:58): malmen paste the contents of fedora-updates.repo to the pastebin

26028c1f9b22a689752bf264e6a75afe (00:59): Irishman: yeah, if you prefer kde, then don't install gnome if you have limited space, may also want to consider leaving out some larger packages like open office
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (00:59): and fedora.repo
2ba47b304ea2642eb488025d18f588c0 (00:59): AntonTakk: No problem, sounds like a good plan, I'll give it a go... no I know this is a dumb question, but I need all the 5 discs right?

e75f5e766933fbe99872b95c02a19efa (01:09): Hello. I'm a total newbie to Fedora Core and would like to know how to get GDM started up in runlevel 3. Can someone tell me or direct me to a FAQ, please?
e75f5e766933fbe99872b95c02a19efa (01:09): (Googling around didn't turn up any useful results for me)
45761c76b21ef734a800e31fdcbc5e44 (01:09): http://pastebin.com/745478
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (01:10): dwh: why level 3 and not 5?
e75f5e766933fbe99872b95c02a19efa (01:10): jlc:  Oh, isn't level 3 the default?
e75f5e766933fbe99872b95c02a19efa (01:10): jlc:  As it is now, I have to type init 5 at the prompt to get it running. I want it to automatically come up when I boot my machine.
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (01:10): vi /etc/inittab
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (01:11): id:5:initdefault:
45761c76b21ef734a800e31fdcbc5e44 (01:12): jlc http://pastebin.com/745478
e75f5e766933fbe99872b95c02a19efa (01:12): jlc:  Interesting. Mine says "id:3:initdefault:" and at the end of the file there's "x:5:once:/etc/X11/prefdm -nodaemon"
e75f5e766933fbe99872b95c02a19efa (01:12): jlc:  I'll just make 5 the default, then. Thanks :-)
2796a17c233c67456f9b243084971fb4 (01:12): hello people, would anyone know where I can download libpthread ?
